bug.short_desc: Provide a module for the FakeServer functionality

long_desc.thetext:
The fakeServer class is a useful implementation to make a web application decoupled from the middleware service.
A q module would make it possible to use this implementation within the website scenarios.
This module will be only used in development so small file size doesn't have to be a key feature.

The module "qx.module.dev.FakeServer" (exposed as "q.dev.fakeServer") now wraps "qx.dev.FakeServer" which itself wraps the whole Sinon.JS lib [1]. As stated by Alex this is sufficient for the moment.
However only wrapping the provided "Stand-alone fake XHR/server" [2] would make more sense cause currently no other Sinon.JS features are exposed by the API "qx.module.dev.FakeServer" offers. This would also result in a smaller file size.
[1] http://sinonjs.org/ [2] http://sinonjs.org/download/
